title: Messed Up Thunderbird Profiles
content:
I really messed up my Thunderbird profiles! I just did a "clean" install of Windows 10 (previously had Win 7 installed). I have my Thunderbird profile in M:\Thunderbird". Program is installed on D:\Thunderbird. When I opened Thunderbird using recently installed Win 10, it found my e-mails on gmail and imported them. Then I imported the profile from M:\Thunderbird. Now I have TWO profiles on Thunderbird. Every time I now open Thunderbird, it imports all my new mails into two different places.

Trying to merge them into one profile and now have nothing. Here's what profiles.ini looks like:

[Profile2] Name=paulp575 IsRelative=0 Path=M:\Thunderbird

[Profile1] Name=default IsRelative=1 Path=Profiles/j1vvmapz.default Default=1

[Profile0] Name=default-release IsRelative=1 Path=Profiles/1cd37335.default-release

[General] StartWithLastProfile=1 Version=2

[InstallD7D8687A29006428] Default=M:\Thunderbird Locked=1

How can I change profiles.ini so that Thunderbird only opens the profile at M:\Thunderbird? And also ensures I only have one profile on Thunderbird's main screen? I'd show a screen shot, but now when I open Thunderbird it wants me to go through the process of setting up my account!

THanks.
creator: paulp575123

title: Thunderbird Email Cache Issue
content:

This is a rather new ongoing issue.

title: ics file import / update
content: I have a website from which I can download a calendar as an ics file which I'd like to import. Initially this works OK. However, sometimes this website calendar is amended and I'd like to be able to update my Thunderbird calendar but a subsequent import fails completely if it includes an update to an existing entry. I know that the UID of an event in the ics file matches that of an existing Thunderbird entry but the LAST-MODIFIED value is later in the second ics file entry. Is there any other condition that should be required to allow the import to run and update any matching existing entries? Any ideas welcome. CrowboroughChris
creator: mt16

title: Calendar import from .ics file fails: MODIFICATION_FAILED
content:
While trying to import a .ics into thunderbird calendar an error occurs:

"Beim Schreiben in den Kalender Privat ist ein Fehler aufgetreten! Weitere Informationen stehen weiter unten." "Fehlercode: MODIFICATION_FAILED" "Beschreibung: Falls diese Nachricht nach dem Verwenden von "Zurückstellen" oder "Schließen" für eine Erinnerung angezeigt wird, aber Sie für diesen Kalender keine Termine hinzufügen oder bearbeiten wollen, so können Sie diesen Kalender als schreibgeschützt markieren, um diese Mitteilung nicht mehr angezeigt zu bekommen. Klicken Sie dazu mit der rechten Maustaste auf den Kalender in der Kalenderliste der Termin- oder Aufgabenansicht und öffnen Sie die Eigenschaften."

The .ics file was generated by calendar export from Thunderbird version 115.6.0 and the import is also being done with the same TB version. OS: Linux Mint 21.3 Virginia

I can import the .ics into other calendar software without problems, so it doesn't seem to be damaged.

title: issue when using Calendar (network, ics) - memory usage raises to 3GB, needs 1h to start
content:
Hi, I am using Thunderbird for years and this issue started to happen last week.

I am using a Teamup calendar as an external (readonly) calendar, this is the URI: https://ics.teamup.com/feed/ksrcmy4ajs6stupbg6/5826514.ics

Apparently, from last week when it is enabled, Thunderbird needs about an hour to start and memory rises to 3 GB. I tried older TB versions while I was investigating what is the issue with the strange behavior, from TB ver. 102 and later, but it is the same. At the end I found what was causing this memory consumption and startup slowness and I disabled the calendar and TB works well.

If you follow the link and download ics file it seams ok, it imports to other calendars lika Outlook, Calendar etc. easily.

Please investigate and update and I will send any additional info if needed.

Best regards, Vladimir
creator: vladimir.cakarov

title: Signing on problem with "Outlook accounts only
content:
Hi, I have several Outlook email addresses, a Gmail, a Plusnet and the email address for my website "ellicombe.co.uk". They are all run from Thunderbird and on openning Thunderbird all email addresses signed on automatically. From about a week ago all the Outlook addresses failed to sign on and I receive the message "Login to server outlook.office365.com with username xxxxxxxxx@outlook.com failed." and the option to "Retry", "Enter New Password" or "Cancel". Repeated clicking on "Retry" will provide access but If I try to open a different mail folder (Sent, Template, Archive etc) I am asked to Sign on all over again! All non-Outlook sign on perfectly! This problem occurs when I try to access emails from my laptop or desktop both running Windows 10 and Thunderbird, or my Android mobile with K9. One of the affected email addresses is used by wife from her seperate account on the desktop via Thunderbird and is the only email address installed there. It works correctly

Cheers, Graham.

title: Email will not send
content:
After installing the latest version of Thunderbird yesterday (1-27-2024), Thunderbird can no longer send out any emails on my PC using . I am a retired software engineer and contacted my service provider and after 2 hours of trying to find the issue, we have no clue. My email works fine through my service provider using my Apple products, and an alternate mail program on my PC, but not Thunderbird. Everything worked fine before the latest update. I did reboot my computer last night, and was able to send out 1 email, then it again stop sending. The following is the error message it always sends:

Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: <ec2-15-181-97-27.compute-1.amazonaws.com[15.181.97.27]>: Client host rejected: Access denied.

Before telling me this is a blacklist item, it is coming from Thunderbird and not my PC or service provider. Again other email software programs work with no problems on this PC and this started with the latest update. This is a Thunderbird problem. Please help. Dr. C. Lange
